alert.note: Alert for Matanuska Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued December 23 at 8:08PM AKST until December 24 at 9:00AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM AKST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions occurring. Northeast winds 30 to 50 mph with gusts as high as 65 mph. Visibility reduced to as low as 1/4 mile in blowing snow. There will not be any new snow for this event, just blowing around of existing snow on the ground. * WHERE...Matanuska Valley. * WHEN...Until 9 AM AKST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Widespread blowing snow will significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions will impact travel on area roadways due to the reduced visibility and drifting of snow. Very strong winds could cause tree damage and power outages. Cold wind chills as low as 20 to 30 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Winds will begin to slowly diminish this evening, then drop off more significantly during the day Saturday.
info.instruction: A Blizzard Warning means severe winter weather conditions are expected or occurring. Blowing snow with strong winds and poor visibilities are likely. This will lead to whiteout conditions, making travel very hazardous. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
